alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Sebastian (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Franklin, Crawford, Sebastian, eastern Haskell, Sequoyah, central Latimer, southern Adair, Le Flore and southeastern Cherokee Counties through NOON CDT... At 1130 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 2 miles north of Adair State Park to 2 miles southwest of Gans to 5 miles west of Talihina. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Sallisaw... Poteau... Stilwell... Wilburton... Stigler... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Greenwood... Alma... Barling... Pocola... Muldrow... Heavener... Roland... Lavaca... Spiro... Arkoma... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 24. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 292 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for northwestern and west central Arkansas...and southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
